required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Tolerance and Pharmacokinetics of TQB2858 Injection in Subjects With Terminal Malignant Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Dose Escalation Study to Evaluate the Tolerance and Pharmacokinetics of TQB2858 Injection in Subjects With Terminal Malignant Tumor

lead_sponsor.agency: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a phase I study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of TQB2858 injection in patients with advanced malignancy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Each subject started from the signing of the informed consent until 30 days after the last administration or the start of a new target indication
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of all adverse events (AE), serious adverse events (SAE) and treatment-related adverse events (TEAEs)

arm_group.description: TQB2858 administered intravenously (IV) once every 3 week

intervention.description: TQB2858 administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each 21-day. The established dose of TQB2858 is diluted with normal saline [0.9% (w/v) sodium chloride solution], and the infusion time is 60 Â± 10 min.
